speaker: Lucas
text: If I wake up early and avoid distractions, I usually finish my deep work by noon.
ipa: ɪf aɪ weɪk ʌp ˈɝli ənd əˈvɔɪd dɪˈstɹækʃənz | aɪ ˈjuʒəwəli ˈfɪnɪʃ maɪ dip wɝk baɪ nun
stress: IF I WAKE UP EARLY and AVOID DISTRACTIONS | I USUALLY FINISH my DEEP WORK by NOON
linking:
"wake up" → /weɪk ʌp/ (k + ʌ linking)
"deep work" → /dip wɝk/ (p + w linking)

speaker: Tania
text: Lucky you. If I had a quieter apartment, I would get way more done in the mornings.
ipa: ˈlʌki ju | ɪf aɪ hæd ə ˈkwaɪətɚ əˈpɑɹtmənt | aɪ wʊd ɡɛt weɪ mɔɹ dʌn ɪn ðə ˈmɔɹnɪŋz
stress: LUCKY YOU | IF I HAD a QUIETER APARTMENT | I WOULD GET WAY MORE DONE in the MORNINGS
linking:
"had a" → /hæd ə/ (d + ə linking)
"get way" → /ɡɛt weɪ/ (t + w linking)

speaker: Lucas
text: Totally. You might feel more focused if you tried working from a co-working space once or twice a week.
ipa: ˈtoʊtəli | ju maɪt fil mɔɹ ˈfoʊkəst | ɪf ju tɹaɪd ˈwɝkɪŋ fɹəm ə ˈkoʊˌwɝkɪŋ speɪs wʌns ɔɹ twaɪs ə wik
stress: TOTALLY | YOU MIGHT FEEL MORE FOCUSED | IF YOU TRIED WORKING from a CO-WORKING SPACE ONCE or TWICE a WEEK
linking:
"feel more" → /fil mɔɹ/ (l + m linking)
"working from" → /ˈwɝkɪŋ fɹəm/ (ŋ + f linking)

speaker: Tania
text: Maybe! I’d go provided that it has good internet and decent coffee.
ipa: ˈmeɪbi | aɪd ɡoʊ pɹəˈvaɪdɪd ðæt ɪt hæz ɡʊd ˈɪntɚˌnɛt ənd ˈdisənt ˈkɑfi
stress: MAYBE! I’D GO PROVIDED that it HAS GOOD INTERNET and DECENT COFFEE
linking:
"go provided" → /ɡoʊ pɹəˈvaɪdɪd/ (o + p linking)
"good internet" → /ɡʊd ˈɪntɚˌnɛt/ (d + i linking)

speaker: Lucas
text: Haha, fair. As long as you set boundaries with Slack and emails, your afternoons will be more productive.
ipa: hɑ hɑ fɛɹ | æz lɔŋ æz ju sɛt ˈbaʊndɚiz wɪð slæk ənd ˈiːmeɪlz | jɔɹ ˌæftɚˈnunz wɪl bi mɔɹ pɹəˈdʌktɪv
stress: HAHA, FAIR | AS LONG AS YOU SET BOUNDARIES with SLACK and EMAILS | YOUR AFTERNOONS will be MORE PRODUCTIVE
linking:
"set boundaries" → /sɛt ˈbaʊndɚiz/ (t + b linking)
"with Slack" → /wɪð slæk/ (ð + s linking)

speaker: Tania
text: Yeah, I need to work on that. If I weren’t constantly switching tasks, my code quality would improve a lot.
ipa: jæ | aɪ nid tu wɝk ɑn ðæt | ɪf aɪ ˈwɝnt ˈkɑnstəntli ˈswɪʧɪŋ tæsks | maɪ koʊd ˈkwɑləti wʊd ɪmˈpɹuv ə lɑt
stress: YEAH, I NEED to WORK on THAT | IF I WEREN’T CONSTANTLY SWITCHING TASKS | MY CODE QUALITY would IMPROVE a LOT
linking:
"work on" → /wɝk ɑn/ (k + ɑ linking)
"code quality" → /koʊd ˈkwɑləti/ (d + q linking)

speaker: Lucas
text: Also, unless I schedule breaks deliberately, I just burn out halfway through the day.
ipa: ˈɔlsoʊ | ənˈlɛs aɪ ˈskɛʤul bɹeɪks dɪˈlɪbɚətli | aɪ ʤəst bɝn aʊt ˈhæfweɪ θɹu ðə deɪ
stress: ALSO, UNLESS I SCHEDULE BREAKS DELIBERATELY | I JUST BURN OUT HALFWAY THROUGH the DAY
linking:
"schedule breaks" → /ˈskɛʤul bɹeɪks/ (l + b linking)
"burn out" → /bɝn aʊt/ (n + aʊ linking)

speaker: Tania
text: Same. That’s why I plan my day in case something urgent comes up unexpectedly.
ipa: seɪm | ðæts waɪ aɪ plæn maɪ deɪ ɪn keɪs ˈsʌmθɪŋ ˈɝʤənt kʌmz ʌp ˌʌnɪkˈspɛktɪdli
stress: SAME | THAT’S WHY I PLAN MY DAY in CASE SOMETHING URGENT COMES UP UNEXPECTEDLY
linking:
"plan my" → /plæn maɪ/ (n + m linking)
"comes up" → /kʌmz ʌp/ (z + ʌ linking)

speaker: Lucas
text: Smart move. Even if things go off track, having structure helps you reset faster.
ipa: smɑɹt muv | ˈivən ɪf θɪŋz ɡoʊ ɔf tɹæk | ˈhævɪŋ ˈstɹʌktʃɚ hɛlps ju ɹiˈsɛt ˈfæstɚ
stress: SMART MOVE | EVEN IF THINGS GO OFF TRACK | HAVING STRUCTURE HELPS YOU RESET FASTER
linking:
"go off" → /ɡoʊ ɔf/ (o + ɔ linking)
"helps you" → /hɛlps ju/ (s + j linking)
